Description: Large open handmade ceramic bowl with a plain rim, flaring walls and rounded base. Traces of red paint and burnishing on interior and exterior, while exterior is mottled with firing stains. Restored from fragments with some pieces missing.
Curator's comments: This bowl bears the excavation mark 3/31/6, which is incorrect, and another mark, now illegible. Written in pencil on the bowl is the remark, 'number doubtful'.
